group_1.textLeft: *Huff* *Puff* I couldn't even lay a finger@on you...
Have you calmed down?

group_1.textRight: Please tell us exactly what you were@fighting about.
If I remember correctly, you were warned@once before. Am I wrong?

group_1.textLeft: W-well, yes I was.
But you haven't solved anything since then!
We don't even know if Chuo Ward will be@joining the west or not!

group_1.textCenter: Actually, this is also the perfect chance for@me to throw in my two cents.
I think the problem also lies with you for@not being able to decide on a clear policy.
It makes me second guess whether we can@rely on you or not.

group_1.textLeft: I'm aware of the situation.
I know quite well that I need to decide on a@policy sooner rather than later.

group_1.textRight: Our original goal yesterday was to ask other@teams for their input, after all.

group_1.textLeft: Yes. No matter what decision is made, there@will always be those who disagree.
At this rate, it's quite possible that the@west will break from the inside.

group_1.textRight: You're right. There don't seem to be any@rebels right now, but...

group_1.textLeft: It could just be a matter of time.
It all started with the attack in that@Labyrinth.
Ever since then, even the more passive girls@have been getting involved.

group_1.textRight: They're trying to make a statement; that@Chuo Ward should belong to the west.
As if to say, "Don't give Chuo to the cowards@in the east who stab people in the back."

group_1.textLeft: If we could get Chuo Ward to join the west,@like those girls wanted...
I'm sure that'd calm them down.
It might be worth it to get Chuo Ward for@that purpose.

group_1.textRight: I don't think the east will stay quiet.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, it's inevitable that we'll face an@even greater battle than this.
And there's no doubt that the location@of that battle will be Chuo Ward.

group_1.textRight: If that happens, then the Magical Girls@there will be less likely to trust us...

group_1.textLeft: Yes. We'll end up with yet another conflict@to deal with.
That isn't the best solution by any means.
However, things will only get worse if we do@nothing and hand Chuo Ward to the east.
We're at a standstill.

group_1.textRight: Perhaps it'd be worth it to speak to Kanagi@again?
We should cooperate to prevent Magical Girls@from harming each other any further.

group_1.textLeft: Kanagi is impossible to deal with.
We'd be able to negotiate if we knew who@the person behind the attack was.
But we'd just end up in a pointless argument@if we spoke to her now.
We can't make any big unnecessary moves@any more than she can.
As leaders, we must consider the benefits@to our community as a whole.
It would be a different story if we could at@least provide common cause.
But it isn't possible to simply cooperate...

group_1.textRight: Let's at least warn the Magical Girls in the@west to avoid going to Chuo Ward.

group_1.textLeft: Yes. I don't expect it to be very effective,@but that needs to be the policy on our side.

group_1.textRight: Right. I hope this helps to cut back on the@number of Magical Girls getting hurt.

group_1.narration: Mifuyu's hopes were, however, in vain...
The situation from here@only continued to worsen...
